      • translate

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String translate(java.lang.String key,
                                                     java.lang.String locale,
                                                     java.lang.Long siteId)
                                              throws WorkerException
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a message string matching local,key,site NOTE: This method expects that key is already hash code of some text. Use #translateText(String, String, String)
        Parameters:
        key - translation key.
        locale -
        siteId - site string id ( for example demosite )
        Returns:
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • translateText

        public static java.lang.String translateText(java.lang.String text,
                                             java.lang.String locale,
                                             java.lang.Long siteId)
        Translates text. Returns translation of the specified text in specified language. Note that key is generated from text so it should be default English text hardcoded somewhere like in digi:trn tag If specified local was not default language and nothing is found then it tries to find English translation. If even English translation was not found then it is created using text, siteId specified and English local.
        Parameters:
        text - default text that should be translated, this is used to generate key
        locale - language code for which translation should be searched.
        siteId - id of digi site.
        Returns:
        text translated text or default text
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • translateText

        public static java.lang.String translateText(java.lang.String text,
                                             java.lang.String locale,
                                             Site site)

      • translateText

        public static java.lang.String translateText(java.lang.String text)
        translates text using the TLS-stored locale and siteId in case of an underlying exception, returns untranslated text, as this is what all the translateText(String, String, Long) users did anyway
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • translateText

        public static java.lang.String translateText(java.lang.String text,
                                             java.lang.String keyWords,
                                             java.lang.String locale,
                                             java.lang.Long siteId)
        Translates text to specified local. If nothing found, it retries to translate the string using the alternate site_id (please see the mess described in AMP-14236 and AMP-14232 for more info) see #translateText(String, String, String) for more details.
        Parameters:
        text -
        keyWords -
        locale -
        siteId -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • getByBody

        public Message getByBody(java.lang.String originalText,
                         java.lang.String local,
                         java.lang.Long siteId)
        Retrieves translation using original text for searching.
        Parameters:
        originalText - used to generate key for searching, this should be always be default text in English, tag body or string constant from code.
        local - language code to witch original text should be translated.
        siteId - site ID of for which translation should be searched.
        Returns:
        message bean which contains translated text or default text if translation was not not found.
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • getByKey

        public Message getByKey(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String locale,
                        Site site)

      • getByKey

        public Message getByKey(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String defaultText,
                        java.lang.String keyWords,
                        java.lang.String locale,
                        java.lang.Long siteId)
        Returns message by key, site and local. This method searches db. See overloaded pair in CachedTranslatorWorker Note that there is old workaround in this method which breaks this description.
        Parameters:
        key - mandatory.
        defaultText - default text. Should not be null.
        keyWords - used for grouping. not mandatory
        locale - specifies in which language this message should be searched. part of the key, mandatory.
        siteId - part of the key. mandatory.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • getByKey

        public Message getByKey(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String defaultText,
                        java.lang.String keyWords,
                        java.lang.String locale,
                        java.lang.Long siteId,
                        org.hibernate.Session dbSession)
        Returns message by key, site and local. This method searches db. See overloaded pair in CachedTranslatorWorker Note that there is old workaround in this method which breaks this description.
        Parameters:
        key - mandatory.
        defaultText - default text. Should not be null.
        keyWords - used for grouping. not mandatory
        locale - specifies in which language this message should be searched. part of the key, mandatory.
        siteId - part of the key. mandatory.
        dbSession - database session to get the meesage from. In case null using session from persistence manager
        Returns:
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • processBodyChars

        protected void processBodyChars(Message message)
        Removes new line chars from message body. Fore more details see AMP-4611
        Parameters:
        message -

      • processOriginalMessage

        protected void processOriginalMessage(Message message)
        Sets original message value to value of message. This will be done only if original message is null and key generated from message is same as key field value. this will mean that key was generated from that same message and hence it is the original message. We need to store this to avoid problems when default translation is changed. See AMP-6663 for details.
        Parameters:
        message -

      • processSpecialChars

        public static java.lang.String processSpecialChars(java.lang.String text)
        Processes special characters for translations to make it compatible with translations rules. currently removes new line and carriage return symbols.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • makeTextJSFriendly

        public static java.lang.String makeTextJSFriendly(java.lang.String text)
        Makes string compatible for using within JavaScript string definition. Adds slashes in front of string start-end symbols.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • setHash

        protected void setHash(Message message)
        Generates hash code from message body and sets it as key. WARN: Use for non-English messages ONLY if there is no English record for same key. Hash key should be generated from English translation because it is default language.
        Parameters:
        message - translation entity to update

      • generateTrnKey

        public static java.lang.String generateTrnKey(java.lang.String text)
        Generates translation key from message body. Currently String.hashCode() is used for this purpose.
        Parameters:
        text - any text that but usually this should be body for trn tag or default translation text.
        Returns:
        key for translation, actually it is hash code of the text.

      • generateTrnKey

        public static java.lang.String generateTrnKey(java.lang.String text,
                                              boolean usePrefix)

      • updateTimeStamp

        protected void updateTimeStamp(Message message)
        Puts message in update queue. This is done every time message is accessed. When message is put in queue this also updates last access time field of the message with current time. Another lower priority worker thread will take this message out from queue and update it in db.
        Parameters:
        message -
        See Also:
        TrnAccessUpdateQueue, TrnAccesTimeSaver

      • saveDb

        protected void saveDb(Message message)
        Saves message in db. Removes form access time queue if this message is waiting update there too.
        Parameters:
        message -
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • update

        public void update(Message message)
        Updates a particular message in db.
        Parameters:
        message -
        Throws:
        WorkerException

      • updateDb

        protected void updateDb(Message message)
        Does actual update of the message in db. Also if same message waits for update in last access time queue, then it is removed from that queue to not overwrite latest changes.
        Parameters:
        message -
        Throws:
        WorkerException
        See Also:
        TrnAccessUpdateQueue, TrnAccesTimeSaver

      • getAllTranslationsOfKey

        public static java.util.Collection<Message> getAllTranslationsOfKey(java.lang.String key,
                                                                    java.lang.Long siteId)
                                                             throws WorkerException
        Returns all translations for specified key on specified site. If any some translation has been translated in 3 languages, then this will find all 3 records for the key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        siteId -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        WorkerException
